bug.author: MarcSkovMadsen
bug.summary: Streamlit does not support all the emojis listed at the reference list from WebFX
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
In your documentation you write you support all codes at <denchmark-link:https://www.webfx.com/tools/emoji-cheat-sheet/>https://www.webfx.com/tools/emoji-cheat-sheet/</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42288570/71464393-84488680-27b9-11ea-88b6-0c1845c8e0cf.png></denchmark-link>
For me that does not hold <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42288570/71464433-a215eb80-27b9-11ea-9f9a-e5501b0c523c.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
import streamlit as st st.markdown(":bowtie:") <denchmark-h:h2>Expected and Actual behavior:</denchmark-h>
The emoji is shown and not the text bowtie with colons around.
Streamlit version: 0.52.2 Python version: 3.7.4 Using python -m venv .venv OS version: Windows 8.1 Browser version: Chrome
<denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
You can see all the non-supported codes via the "Emojis" app in the Gallery at awesome-streamlit.org or run the code at <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarcSkovMadsen/awesome-streamlit/master/gallery/emojis/emojis.py>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/MarcSkovMadsen/awesome-streamlit/master/gallery/emojis/emojis.py</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42288570/71464680-9a0a7b80-27ba-11ea-9661-c94ea56410ae.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment: Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MarcSkovMadsen>@MarcSkovMadsen</denchmark-link> , Thanks for reporting this!, I'm sending a PR in order to change the current list to the one that we are actually using which is part from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/omnidan/node-emoji>node-emoji</denchmark-link> . Remember that we support unicode emoji as well. :)
